<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Predict-car-mileage-using-car-features">Predict car mileage using car features<a class="anchor-link" href="#Predict-car-mileage-using-car-features">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>I will implement the Linear Regression algorithm with squared penalization term in the objective function (Ridge Regression) using <code>Numpy</code> in <code>Python</code>. Further, we will apply the algorithm to predict the miles per gallon for a car using six features about that car.</p>
<p>The data is already standardized and can be obtained here <a href="https://github.com/anujk3/ml_datasets/tree/master/ml-regression">Github link</a>.</p>
<p>The input variables are anonymous except the 4th and 6th dimension which correspond to <strong>car weight</strong> and <strong>car year</strong>.</p>
<p>The penalization coefficient ($\lambda$) is varied and the feature weights are plotted against degree of freedoms for values of $\lambda$ ranging from 0 to 5000.</p>
<p>$\lambda = 0 $ corresponds to Simple Linear Regression (no penalty)</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
\begin{equation} w_{rr} = arg \ \underset{w}{min}\ \left\Vert y - Xw\right\Vert^2 + \lambda\ \left\Vert w \right\Vert^2  \end{equation}\begin{equation}
\begin{split}
L &=\ \left\Vert y - Xw \right \Vert^2 + \lambda \ \left \Vert w \right \Vert ^2 \\
 &=(y - Xw)^{T} (y - Xw) + \lambda w^T w 
\end{split}
\end{equation}<p>To find optimum value for $ w_{rr} $, we take the gradient of $L$ and set it to zero</p>
\begin{equation}
\nabla L_w = -2X^Ty + 2X^TXw + 2\lambda w = 0
\end{equation}\begin{equation}\tag{1}
w_{rr} = (\lambda I + X^TX)^{-1}X^Ty
\end{equation}<p>Degrees of Freedom:</p>
\begin{equation}\tag{2}
df(\lambda) = trace \ [X(X^TX + \lambda I)^{-1}X^T]
\end{equation}
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [1]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">numpy</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">np</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">matplotlib.pyplot</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">plt</span>
<span class="o">%</span><span class="k">matplotlib</span> inline
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">rcParams</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"figure.figsize"</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">8</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Ridge-Regression-function-implemented-using-Numpy">Ridge Regression function implemented using Numpy<a class="anchor-link" href="#Ridge-Regression-function-implemented-using-Numpy">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [1]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">SolveRidgeRegression</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">wRR_list</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[]</span>
    <span class="n">df_list</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[]</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">i</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">5001</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="n">lam_par</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">i</span>
        <span class="n">xtranspose</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">transpose</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">xtransx</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">dot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">xtranspose</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">X</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">xtransx</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">!=</span> <span class="n">xtransx</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]:</span>
            <span class="k">raise</span> <span class="ne">ValueError</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Needs to be a square matrix for inverse'</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">lamidentity</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">identity</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">xtransx</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">lam_par</span>
        <span class="n">matinv</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">linalg</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">inv</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">lamidentity</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">xtransx</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">xtransy</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">dot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">xtranspose</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">wRR</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">dot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">matinv</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">xtransy</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">_</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">S</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">_</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">linalg</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">svd</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">square</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">S</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">square</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">S</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">lam_par</span><span class="p">))</span>
        <span class="n">wRR_list</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">wRR</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">df_list</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">wRR_list</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">df_list</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Degree-of-Freedom-Plots-with-varying-hyperparameter,-$\lambda$">Degree of Freedom Plots with varying hyperparameter, $\lambda$<a class="anchor-link" href="#Degree-of-Freedom-Plots-with-varying-hyperparameter,-$\lambda$">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [2]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">makeDFPlots</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dfArray</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">wRRArray</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="c1">#print wRR_array.shape, df_array.shape</span>
    <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">figure</span><span class="p">()</span>
    <span class="n">colors</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'#e41a1c'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'#377eb8'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'#4daf4a'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'#984ea3'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'#ff7f00'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'#ffff33'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'#a65628'</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="n">labels</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"Dimension 1"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"Dimension 2"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"Dimension 3"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"Dimension 4 (car weight)"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"Dimension 5"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"Dimension 6 (car year)"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"Dimension 7"</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">i</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">wRR_list</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]):</span>
        <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dfArray</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">wRRArray</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">color</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">colors</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">])</span>
        <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">scatter</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dfArray</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">wRRArray</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">color</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">colors</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">s</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">8</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">label</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">labels</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">])</span>
    <span class="c1"># df(lambda)</span>
    <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xlabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">r</span><span class="s2">"df($\lambda$)"</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="c1"># and a legend</span>
    <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">legend</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">loc</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'lower left'</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">show</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Calling-Ridge-Regression-on-Data">Calling Ridge Regression on Data<a class="anchor-link" href="#Calling-Ridge-Regression-on-Data">¶</a></h3>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">

<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">X_train</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">genfromtxt</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'hw1-data/X_train.csv'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">delimiter</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">','</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">y_train</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">genfromtxt</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'hw1-data/y_train.csv'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

<span class="n">wRRArray</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">asarray</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">wRR_list</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">dfArray</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">asarray</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df_list</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

</div>

<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">makeDFPlots</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dfArray</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">wRRArray</span><span class="p">)</span>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h4 id="Inference-about-the-above-plot">Inference about the above plot<a class="anchor-link" href="#Inference-about-the-above-plot">¶</a></h4>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<ol>
<li><p>From the solution, we know that when the df($\lambda$) is the maximum value, that corresponds to $\lambda$ equal to 0, which is the least squares solution. The fourth dimension (car weight) and the sixth dimension (car year) have the highest magnitude, which indicates that they are the most important features in determining the fuel efficiency for cars. As the sixth dimension it positive, it shows that the fuel efficiency increases with the increase in car years and as the fourth dimension is negative, it shows that the fuel efficiency decreases with the increase in car weight.</p>
</li>
<li><p>So, we can say that for the least squares solution, the dimensions 4 (car weight) and dimensions 6 (car year) are the most important dimensions which affect the solution, but because we always try and regularize the weights to be small, their weights get penalized the most by including the hyper parameter ($\lambda$) for Ridge Regression and varying it.</p>
</li>
<li><p>As $\lambda$ is always greater than 0, increasing the values of $\lambda$ leads to a decrease in the degrees of freedom and regularized weights for all the covariates in our solution.</p>
</li>
</ol>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Plot-RMSE-values-with-varying-hyperparameter,-$\lambda$">Plot RMSE values with varying hyperparameter, $\lambda$<a class="anchor-link" href="#Plot-RMSE-values-with-varying-hyperparameter,-$\lambda$">¶</a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [7]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">X_test</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">genfromtxt</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'hw1-data/X_test.csv'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">delimiter</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">','</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">y_test</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">genfromtxt</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'hw1-data/y_test.csv'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [8]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">plotRMSEValue</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">max_lamda</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">RMSE_list</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">poly</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">colors</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'#e41a1c'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'#377eb8'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'#4daf4a'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'#984ea3'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'#ff7f00'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'#ffff33'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'#a65628'</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="n">legend</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"Polynomial Order, p = 1"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"Polynomial Order, p = 2"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"Polynomial Order, p = 3"</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">xrange</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">RMSE_list</span><span class="p">)),</span> <span class="n">RMSE_list</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">color</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">colors</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">poly</span><span class="p">])</span>
    <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">scatter</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">xrange</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">RMSE_list</span><span class="p">)),</span> <span class="n">RMSE_list</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">color</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">colors</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">poly</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">s</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">8</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">label</span><span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">legend</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">poly</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">])</span>
    <span class="c1"># df(lambda)</span>
    <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xlabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">r</span><span class="s2">"$\lambda$"</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ylabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"RMSE"</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="c1"># and a legend</span>
    <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">legend</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">loc</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'upper left'</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">title</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">r</span><span class="s2">"RMSE vs $\lambda$ values for the test set, $\lambda$ = 0..</span><span class="si">%d</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="o">%</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">max_lamda</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [9]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">getRMSEValues</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_test</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y_test</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">wRRArray</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">max_lamda</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">poly</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">RMSE_list</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[]</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">lamda</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">xrange</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">max_lamda</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="n">wRRvals</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">wRRArray</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">lamda</span><span class="p">]</span>
        <span class="n">y_pred</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">dot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_test</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">wRRvals</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">RMSE</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sqrt</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">square</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">y_test</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">y_pred</span><span class="p">))</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">y_test</span><span class="p">))</span>
        <span class="n">RMSE_list</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">RMSE</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">plotRMSEValue</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">max_lamda</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">RMSE_list</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">poly</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">poly</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [10]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">figure</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">getRMSEValues</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_test</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y_test</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">wRRArray</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">max_lamda</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">50</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">poly</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">show</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>From the figure, we can understand that the least RMSE value is obtained for $\lambda$ = 0 and as the value of $\lambda$ increase, the RMSE increases. Also, as $\lambda$ = 0 is the least squares solution, which gives the least RMSE value, for this particular problem, using just the polynomial order 1 covariates, we should use the least squares solution, i.e., $\lambda$ = 0 instead of using Ridge Regression (where $\lambda$ > 0).</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Ridge-Regression-with-Polynomial-Features">Ridge Regression with Polynomial Features<a class="anchor-link" href="#Ridge-Regression-with-Polynomial-Features">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [11]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">addPolynomialOrder</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">input_matrix</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">p</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">p</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">input_matrix</span>
    <span class="k">elif</span> <span class="n">p</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">a</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">input_matrix</span>
        <span class="n">b</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">power</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">input_matrix</span><span class="p">[:,</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">6</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">out</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">hstack</span><span class="p">((</span><span class="n">a</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">b</span><span class="p">))</span>
        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">out</span>
    <span class="k">elif</span> <span class="n">p</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">a</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">input_matrix</span>
        <span class="n">b</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">power</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">input_matrix</span><span class="p">[:,</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">6</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">c</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">power</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">input_matrix</span><span class="p">[:,</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">6</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">out</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">hstack</span><span class="p">((</span><span class="n">a</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">b</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">c</span><span class="p">))</span>
        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">out</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [12]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">## Set xlimits for the graphs</span>

<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">figure</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">i</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">]:</span>
    <span class="n">X_train_appended</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">addPolynomialOrder</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">p</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">i</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">X_test_appended</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">addPolynomialOrder</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_test</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">p</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">i</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">wRR_list</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">df_list</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">SolveRidgeRegression</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train_appended</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y_train</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">wRRArray</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">asarray</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">wRR_list</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">dfArray</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">asarray</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df_list</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">getRMSEValues</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_test_appended</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y_test</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">wRRArray</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">max_lamda</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">500</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">poly</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">show</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><strong> Inference of above plot : RMSE values with varying hyperparameters for different polynomial order features </strong></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Looking at the curves, we should choose the polynomial order p = 2, as it results in the lowest RMSE value for a particular value of $\lambda$ at 21. Also at p = 3, we get nearly the same lowest RMSE value at $\lambda$ = 23, but we should choose the simpler model obtained using p = 2.</p>
<p>We can say that when p = 1, it produces a simpler model that underfits the data. When p = 2 or p = 3, at lower values of $\lambda$, the model fits the data better (might also overfit) and gives the least RMSE values and can be chosen. We see that on further increasing the $\lambda$ values for higher order's of p, we still underfit the data with an increase in the RMSE values.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
